bill_title: Honoring the Flandreau 16 and Under Softball Team, coaches, and players.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring the Flandreau 16 and Under Softball Team, coaches, and players. WHEREAS, the Flandreau 16 and Under Softball Team won their second State 16 and Under Division championship; and WHEREAS, the Flandreau Softball Team members Josh Bruning, Austin Wiese, Wade Quick, Eric Adloph, Chris Wiese, Tate Sutton, Owen Wiese, Jason Ramsdell, Max Fargen, Holist Sutton, Jesse Miller, Daniel Julson, Dusty LeBrun, and Adam Julson be recognized for their outstanding teamwork; and WHEREAS, the Flandreau Softball Team showed great dedication and sportsmanship throughout the 2002 season; and WHEREAS, coaches John Wiese, Adam Shaw, and Scott Ramsdell's leadership inspired great performances on the field: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Flandreau 16 and Under Softball Team be recognized for their 2002 championship season.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring the Flandreau 16 and Under Softball Team, coaches, and players. WHEREAS, the Flandreau 16 and Under Softball Team won their second State 16 and Under Division championship; and WHEREAS, the Flandreau Softball Team members Josh Bruning, Austin Wiese, Wade Quick, Eric Adloph, Chris Wiese, Tate Sutton, Owen Wiese, Jason Ramsdell, Max Fargen, Holist Sutton, Jesse Miller, Daniel Julson, Dusty LeBrun, and Adam Julson be recognized for their outstanding teamwork; and WHEREAS, the Flandreau Softball Team showed great dedication and sportsmanship throughout the 2002 season; and WHEREAS, coaches John Wiese, Adam Shaw, and Scott Ramsdell's leadership inspired great performances on the field: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Flandreau 16 and Under Softball Team be recognized for their 2002 championship season.
